availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Owensboro, Daviess County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Mary B. Winstead. Father of Minnie Winstead. Merchant in Owensboro in 1860. Served as Second Lieutenant in the Fourth Regiment Infantry Kentucky (C.S.A.) from September 13, 1861 to December 1862. Promoted to Captain on January 10, 1863. Wounded in battle at Resaca, Georgia on May 14, 1864. Wounded in battle at Dallas, Georgia on May 29, 1864. Served as Provost Marshal under Provost Marshal General Martin H. Cofer in Tennessee.

ab.bibl:
The Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 150 - 151.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess, Owensboro, p. 945.
